field.name: Title

definition.attribution: Dublin Core Metadata Element Set, Version 1.1: Reference Description at http://dublincore.org/documents/dces/

field.definition: A name given to the resource.

dos.practice: Enter a name by which the resource is formally known.
Specify subtitles but do not use the word subtitle; rather separate a subtitle from a title with a colon.
Enter multiple titles in the order in which they appear on the resource or in order of their importance.
Use separate Title elements to enter multiple titles or clearly separate each entry by a semicolon and a space within an element.

donts.practice: Do not include individual page or paragraph headings in title.
Do not use phrases like "by Joe Smith" in title.
Do not include phrases like "Welcome to the". Such phrases can be omitted.

otherPractice.practice: Transcribe the title, if there is one, from the resource itself, such as a caption from a photograph or a title on a map. When no title is found on the resource itself, use a title assigned by the contributing institution or found in reference sources.

If the creator or publisher does not display a title on screen for the user, create a title to describe the overall content of the resource. Follow this with the phrase "title provided or enhanced by cataloger" in parentheses.

examples.practice: Title and subtitle:Clouds: How Condensation Happens.
Title enhancement by cataloger: Mountain Simulation: Assignment (title provided or enhanced by cataloger).
